results.title: Fast Forward
results.brief_description: Fast Forward was Australia’s highest rating, longest-running and most critically awarded commercial television sketch comedy show, broadcast for 90 one hour episodes from 12 April 1989 to 26 November 1992.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1980s
constellations_other.description: Australian television in the 80s really began to find its footing with mainstream hits becoming landmarks of the industry.

results.description:
Fast Forward was Australia’s highest rating, longest-running and most critically awarded commercial television sketch comedy show, broadcast for 90 one hour episodes from 12 April 1989 to 26 November 1992.

The show was produced by Steve Vizard, who was also the Executive Producer, writer and performer, and starred Jane Turner, Gina Riley, Magda Szubanski, Marg Downey, Michael Veitch, Peter Moon, Alan Pentland, Steve Blackburn, Geoff Brookes, Ernie Dingo, the Rubbery Figures satirical puppets, and numerous guests and supporting stars, such as Gerry Connolly and Brian Dawe.

Fast Forward was succeeded by the related series Full Frontal, and subsequently Totally Full Frontal, which were broadcast from 1993 to 1999 and which starred many of the original Fast Forward cast as well as many iconic performers including Eric Bana, Stephen Curry, Glenn Robbins, Shaun Micallef, Kitty Flanagan and Julia Morris.

Fast Forward was directed by Ted Emery. In its second and subsequent series, Andrew Knight joined Steve Vizard and Ted Emery as Executive Producers of the show. They went on to establish the leading Australian Production house, Artist Services, which produced 1400 hours of prime time television including SeaChange, Big Girls Blouse, Tonight Live with Steve Vizard, the Eric Bana show, the Shaun Micallef Pogram.
description_for_label:

Fast Forward was directed by Ted Emery. In its second and subsequent series, Andrew Knight joined Steve Vizard and Ted Emery as Executive Producers of the show. results.title: Family Ties
results.brief_description: Former 1960s flower children Steven and Elyse Keaton raise their conservative son Alex, daughters Mallory and Jennifer, and later, youngest child Andrew.
results.description: Former 1960s flower children Steven and Elyse Keaton raise their conservative son Alex, daughters Mallory and Jennifer, and later, youngest child Andrew.
description_for_label: Former 1960s flower children Steven and Elyse Keaton raise their conservative son Alex, daughters Mallory and Jennifer, and later, youngest child Andrew.

results.title: Fallen Idols
results.brief_description: Sam and Dean head to a small town where people are murdered by famous dead icons. However the brothers come to a dead end when two teenagers reveal they saw Paris Hilton kidnap their friend.
results.description: Sam and Dean head to a small town where people are murdered by famous dead icons. However the brothers come to a dead end when two teenagers reveal they saw Paris Hilton kidnap their friend.

results.title: Fahrenheit 9/11
results.creator_credit: Michael Moore, Dog Eat Dog Films, Questar Entertainment, Fellowship Adventure Group, BIM Distribuzione, Jim Czarnecki and Kathleen Glynn
results.brief_description: Michael Moore’s view on how the Bush administration allegedly used the tragic events on 9/11 to push forward its agenda for unjust wars in Afghanistan and Iraq.

constellations_other.name: Post-9/11
constellations_other.description: The attacks on the World Trader Center in New York City on September 11 2001 were viewed on live television by audiences around the world. The effects of the attack have been explored across various forms of media.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Moore, Dog Eat Dog Films, Questar Entertainment, Fellowship Adventure Group, BIM Distribuzione, Jim Czarnecki and Kathleen Glynn

results.title: Evil Angels
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1988
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of Lindy Chamberlain who, during a family camping trip to Ayers Rock in central Australia, claimed she witnessed a dingo take her baby daughter, Azaria, from their tent. Azaria’s body was never found and, after investigations and two public inquests, she is charged with murder.

constellations_other.name: Dial M for Media
constellations_other.description: Explores the nature of media use in high-profile cases as well as the ability of media to sway public minds.

results.description: Based on the true story of Lindy Chamberlain who, during a family camping trip to Ayers Rock in central Australia, claimed she witnessed a dingo take her baby daughter, Azaria, from their tent. Azaria’s body was never found and, after investigations and two public inquests, she is charged with murder.

results.title: Euphoria
results.brief_description: A group of high school students navigate love and friendships in a world of drugs, sex, trauma, and social media.

constellations_other.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_other.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

results.description: A group of high school students navigate love and friendships in a world of drugs, sex, trauma, and social media.

results.title: Empire Falls
results.creator_credit: William Teitler, Richard Russo, Stuart Wurtzel, Donna Zakowska, Fred Schepisi, Aspetuck Productions, HBO Films and Marc Platt Productions
results.brief_description: The humorous, poignant story of a declining New England town and its inhabitants, whose lives are deeply rooted in and influenced by the Knox River and its vacant mills, their class differences, and ghosts of the past.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

results.title: El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie
results.creator_credit: Aaron Paul, Vince Gilligan, Melissa Bernstein, Charles Newirth, Judy Rhee, Mark Johnson, Louise Frogley, High Bridge Entertainment, Gran Via Productions and Sony Pictures Television Studios
results.brief_description: In the wake of his dramatic escape from captivity, Jesse Pinkman must come to terms with his past in order to forge some kind of future.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

results.title: Eddie Izzard: Circle
results.brief_description: Town Hall, New York City, 26 June 2000. An evening with Eddie Izzard in which he moves back and forth in time, with religion as the loose but constant theme.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion fantasies
constellations_other.description: The LEGO Movie draws on fan-made stop-motion films for its aesthetic style, but fantastical animation comes in many forms.

results.description: Town Hall, New York City, 26 June 2000. An evening with Eddie Izzard in which he moves back and forth in time, with religion as the loose but constant theme.

results.title: Eat Pray Love
results.creator_credit: Ryan Murphy, Bill Groom, Michael Dennison, Jennifer Salt, Dede Gardner, Plan B Entertainment, Columbia Pictures and Red Om Films
results.brief_description: Liz Gilbert had everything a modern woman is supposed to dream of having – a husband, a house and a successful career – yet like so many others, she found herself lost, confused and searching for what she really wanted in life.

constellations_other.name: Film and TV dreams
constellations_other.description: Fleetwood Mac's 'Dreams' coasted its way back up the charts 40 years after it was first released, thanks to Nathan Apodaca's joyous viral TikTok, but Fleetwood Mac (and Stevie Knicks) have been main staples of screen culture for decades.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ryan Murphy, Bill Groom, Michael Dennison, Jennifer Salt, Dede Gardner, Plan B Entertainment, Columbia Pictures and Red Om Films
results.description: Liz Gilbert had everything a modern woman is supposed to dream of having – a husband, a house and a successful career – yet like so many others, she found herself lost, confused and searching for what she really wanted in life. Newly divorced and at a crossroads, Gilbert steps out of her comfort zone, risking everything to change her life, embarking on a journey around the world that becomes a quest for self-discovery. In her travels, she discovers the true pleasure of nourishment by eating in Italy, the power of prayer in India and, finally and unexpectedly, the inner peace and balance of true love in Bali.
description_for_label: Liz Gilbert had everything a modern woman is supposed to dream of having – a husband, a house and a successful career – yet like so many others, she found herself lost, confused and searching for what she really wanted in life. In her travels, she discovers the true pleasure of nourishment by eating in Italy, the power of prayer in India and, finally and unexpectedly, the inner peace and balance of true love in Bali.
